intro: Mniodes montesinosii, commonly known as the Montesinos' mniodes, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
